relation: BP reported that station D door close button for was not working; could not complete a search-and-secure.
Possible pneumatic problem with PS1. FEEPS/PSS has been checked and appears to be sending the signals requesting that the shutter open. (per P. McNamara)
When users attempt to open PS2, FEEPS trips and PS1 closes. No vacuum valves close, and no PSS faults occur. (Problem occurred at 16:23 on 10/11/04 after the start of Machine Studies.)

Stored beam was lost due to Chain B fault at 22-BM. Indications on Chain B screen showed "Chain A Link Down". The beamline was taken globally offline and SI personnel called. (Initial event recorded in MCR Downtime Record #104843.)
User cannot access Experiment Controls (computers) while PFS, on boom lifts, are in the immediate area cleaning the Visitors' Gallery windows for VIP Visit. This downtime entry is requested by CAT.
Minor fault 442: B_DR1_CLSE_FAIL cannot be reset. PSS on-call T. Dawson is on his way in. WR #16195 submitted.
ASD-SI installed diode across relay coil. Fault indicating insufficient air pressure in the pneumatic manifold stopped occurring. The system was tested for proper operations by ASD-SI.
PSS technician filed Work Request #16145 for adjustment of door close button hardware. Button adjusted and tested for proper operation.
ASD-SI fixed loose connection within PSS FERDP , that was not passing PS2 open signal to FE-EPS.
ASD-SI replaced Chain A Processor Shelf & performed full revalidation of beamline.
PFS completed task of cleaning windows and have left the area. Access to 1-BM control area has been allowed.

ASD-SI adjusted 14-ID-B station door. During troubleshooting, observed slow operation of Station B shutter. Time was spent ensuring that shutter functioned properly. Beamline operations restored upon completion of work.

textBeforeTable: Faults: General Information Machine Stats             Delivered beam:   417 hrs.             Percentage of scheduled time:   98.87%             Downtime during period:   4.77 hrs.             Mean time between faults:   208 hrs. We will address this request at the next OPS Directorate meeting. Can a policy be made that would allow the Argonne Guest House to keep open a certain number of rooms for users?   A user called to reserve a room and was told that up to 200 rooms were currently being blocked in reserve for a conference. Yes, we will check the links and make any corrections necessary to show the correct current schedule. Regarding Long Range Operations schedules that are posted to the web can a link be fixed to point to the current run on the current schedule? The current schedule is actually linked to Upcoming Schedules. There was  a question if messages can be more instructive.   One user suggested that we give a minimum time to repair which would allow a user to leave and return when the problem has been corrected.   Greg Banks has stated that the MCR states the minimum time to recover at the present time. Information and Follow-up There was an auto-page that was sent last week that announced the APS had lost power.   Floor coordinators are currently checking with CATS to see if they wish to
